village_entry.text: You pass through the rusted gates and find yourself on a dirt road leading to a small settlement. The houses are slumped and grey, their timber frames rotting. Yet, you see smoke rising from chimneys and people moving about. They walk with stiff, jerky movements. As you approach, a villager stops and stares at you with eyes that seem too wide, too vacant.

choices.label: Observe them from a distance (Perception Check)

village_square.text: The village square is quiet. A few people are gathered around a dry well, miming the action of drawing water. To your left is an abandoned house (The Abode). To the north lies the path to the Whispering Forest.

village_glitch_reveal.text: You focus your senses. For a split second, the villager flickers. Their skin briefly turns into static, their limbs elongating into impossible angles before snapping back to 'normal'. The world here isn't just decayingâ€”it's rendering incorrectly. They aren't people. They are projections.

choices.label: Keep this knowledge to yourself (High Sanity)

village_elder_talk.text: An old man steps forward. 'The Manor? It stands as it always has. The Anchor holds. We are safe. We are happy.' He repeats the last phrase three times, his voice devoid of inflection.

village_store.text: The store is empty of goods, save for a few rusted tools. The shopkeeper stands behind the counter, staring at the wall.
